EnhancedContent:
We’ve added enhancements to make your GitHub Copilot Chat experience on github.com feel smoother and faster.

### Tool calls in your chat response

You’ll now see clear tool call details so you can track what’s happening in real time when you send Copilot a message. This update helps you:

- Understand the steps Copilot is taking to fulfill your request.
- Course-correct if something fails.
- See references generated by each tool call.

### Easily export a chat to JSON or Markdown

![More menu showing chat export option](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/90f9b92c-304b-437c-a662-1cd58be7d99c)

You can now export a chat to reference it later. To export a conversation:

- Select the chat you want to download.
- Press the more menu (“Manage chat”) and choose **Export**.
- Choose whether you want to export your conversation as a JSON or Markdown file.

### Improvements to repository attachments

![Image showing improvements to repository search when a user searches for the facebook/react repository](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2ff6adad-1c4c-4b4c-9a61-12d76a7cedd9)

We’ve also improved how you attach repositories to chat so you can find the right repository faster. You’ll now see better repository recommendations when you search.

### We’d love to hear from you

Join the discussion within [GitHub Community](https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/186360) to share your thoughts on these improvements, or to share what else you’d like to see in Copilot Chat on the web.
